from __future__ import absolute_import

from havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_yosemite import OpenBMCYosemite
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.lib.decorators import retry
import time
import re

[docs]    def get_bios_reset_options(self):
        return {
            # T32828335 - Boot options changing on Yosemite V2 after cmos clearance
            # TODO: Remove comment  when isssue is fixed on Yosemite V2.
            # TODO since 'bios_util' command is not working as expected
            # putting in a workaround
            'bic_util': self.bic_util_reset_boot_order
        }


    # OEM Related

[docs]    def bic_util_reset_boot_order(self):
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        self.power_off()
        t0 = time.time()
        cmd = "bic-util {} 0xe0 0x25 0x15 0xa0 0x00".format(self.slot_info)
        self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        t1 = time.time()
        self.result_handler.add_cmd_metric(
            "reconnect after %s" % (cmd), t0, t1 - t0, 0, ""
        )



[docs]    def openbmc_flashcp_upgrade_cmd(self, subfile):
        cmd = "/usr/sbin/"
        cmd += "flashcp -v /tmp/%s /dev/mtd5" % subfile
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out


    # OEM Related

[docs]    def clear_boot_order_cmos(self):
        #cmd = "/usr/local/bin/bios-util mb --boot_order enable --clear_CMOS"
        #self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        super(OpenBMCYosemiteV2, self).clear_boot_order_cmos(self.slot_info)
        self.cycle()



[docs]    @retry(tries=6, sleep_seconds=3, exponential=True)
    def get_fw_versions(self):
        out = ""
        for fru in ["bmc", "nic", "%s" % self.slot_info]:
            cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util %s --version" % fru
            out += "%s\n" % self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return self.parse_fw_data(out)



[docs]    def get_critical_services(self):
        '''
        This method returns a list of services that are always expected to
        run on the openBMC Yosemitev2 System
        '''
        return ['sensord', 'healthd', 'fscd']



[docs]    def verify_flash_sensors(self, out):
        #Currently not supported on YV2
        return out



[docs]    def validate_version(self, fw_ver_num):
        # Validate the version to be updated
        # If version > 3.0, then use fw-util command
        # else use flashcp method
        match = map(float, re.findall(r"\d+\.\d+", fw_ver_num))
        for match_string in match:
            if match_string >= 3.0:
                return True
            else:
                return False



[docs]    def fw_update_bmc(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util bmc --update --bmc %s" % (file_path)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
        if reboot:
            self.reboot()
        return out



[docs]    def fw_update_rom(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util bmc --update --rom %s" % (file_path)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
        if reboot:
            self.reboot()
        return out



[docs]    def post_cycle_check(self, filter_errors=None):
        self.validate_vboot_util(filter_errors)



[docs]    def bios_post_flash(self, current_reboot):
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1800)
        if not self.check_powered_on():
            # Turn the power on
            self.power_on()
            time.sleep(30)
        self.power_off()
        time.sleep(30)
        self.cmos_clear()
        if not self.check_powered_12V_on():
            self.ac_cycle()



[docs]    def fw_util_ocpdbg(self):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util ocpdbg --version"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def get_fw_util_options(self):
        base = super(OpenBMCYosemiteV2, self).fw_util_bmc_nic_slot()
        return base
